channel.title: Sports
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from Sports, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Inter Miami Continues To Stock Up For MLS Title Defense With 2 New Signings
item.description: Inter Miami have further bolstered their ranks with the signing of 2025 MLS Goalkeeper of the Year, Dayne St. Clair.

item.title: Greg Olsen on Patriots defeating Dolphins & completing 'Historic Turnaround' to finish with a 14-3 Record
item.description: Greg Olsen and Joe Davis broke down the New England Patriots' historic turnaround this season after they defeated the Miami Dolphins in Week 18.

item.title: NASCAR Driver Tracker: Cup Series Changes for 2026
item.description: Connor Zilisch is making the leap, while Kyle Busch and Ross Chastain get new crew chiefs. Tracking Cup Series personnel changes for 2026.

item.title: USA-Canada Connection: Weston McKennie Defends Jonathan David's Penalty Miss

item.title: College Football Playoff Predictions: Ole Miss Has Momentum Ahead of CFP Semis
item.description: FOX Sports' Laken Litman shares her CFP bracket predictions for the semifinal matchups.

item.title: FCS national championship preview: Illinois State, Montana State starving for title
item.description: Will the Bobcats break through or can the Redbirds cap their amazing run in style?

item.title: Raiders fire Carroll after one season; GM remains
item.description: The Raiders on Monday fired coach Pete Carroll after just one season in which Las Vegas finished 3-14. General manager John Spytek will remain in his ...

item.title: Cards fire Gannon after 15-36 mark in 3 seasons
item.description: The Cardinals fired third-year head coach Jonathan Gannon on Monday, the day after a 37-20 loss to the Rams concluded their worst season of the modern...

item.title: Sources: Ole Miss' Chambliss to stay if waiver OK'd
item.description: QB Trinidad Chambliss has agreed to a deal with Ole Miss for 2026, if the NCAA approves his pending waiver for a sixth season, sources told ESPN.
